dt: {bc}overall quality or character as seen or judged by people in general
{bc}recognition by other people of some characteristic or ability
{bc}a place in public esteem or regard {bc}good name

et: Middle English {it}reputacion{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}reputation-, reputatio{/it} consideration, from {it}reputare{/it}
shortdef: overall quality or character as seen or judged by people in general
recognition by other people of some characteristic or ability
a place in public esteem or regard : good name

dt: {bc}to be regarded by people generally (in some particular light)

dt.t: He has {it}acquired a reputation{/it} as a careful worker.

shortdef: to be regarded by people generally (in some particular light)

dt: {bc}to be as good, enjoyable, etc., as people have been led to believe

dt.t: The cruise ship {it}lived up to its reputation{/it}.

shortdef: to be as good, enjoyable, etc., as people have been led to believe
